page.title: 01CLITHEROE
page.content: Clitheroe is to be found in the heart of Lancashire's Ribble Valley. It is an old market town which has grown around the castle keep that overlooks the town. There was little change until the Industrial Revolution. Then the coming of the cotton mills caused rapid growth and development of the town. Today only one of the original seventeen mills is still producing cotton goods. The main employment is now to be found in the I.C.I. and Ribble Cement works. With Pendle Hill to the east, the River Ribble to the west, the old market town of Clitheroe is now developing its historical and beautiful setting to good advantage.
